title: [Admiral Smith] A3A6A2FFBD3F9A85-00003.7z
description:

[Admiral Smith] A3A6A2FFBD3F9A85-00003.7z		27915KB	$0.00	10 / 10
Notes:
ffmpeg - A very important tool for video converstion and applications that was ported from Linux.  This can capture media from cameras and most input sources for video AND audio.  It also means it can from TV tuner cards AND even your desktop.  Yes, it can capture media output from your viewing panel.  

Examples of syntax:
ffmpeg -i input.mov -pix_fmt rgb565le -r 24 output.mp4
(what does it do?)
It takes the file named "input.mov" and converts it to a color space format of 16 bit which is rrrrrggggggbbbbb with a rate of 24 frames/sec and outputs the data to a filename "output.mp4"

ffplay d:VIDEO_TSVTS_02_1.VOB
(what does it do?)
It plays the file "VTS_02_1.VOB" from an actual DVD disk on drive d.

ffprobe c:UsersPublicVideos"Sample Videos"Bear.wmv
(what does it do?)
It displays data from the file such as color space used, audio compression used, and commentary inside of the file.
 
I recommend placing the files ffmpeg.exe ffprobe.exe and ffplay.exe in your system32 folder so they can be a part of the windows command list. 

"Admiral Smith" of United States of America.
Reviewed 09-29-2014
